articles.title: Frequency-adjusted daratumumab-based regimen versus bortezomib/dexamethasone in newly diagnosed AL amyloidosis: a matched-cohort study.
articles.summary: A frequency-adjusted daratumumab regimen showed promising results compared to standard treatment for patients with newly diagnosed AL amyloidosis.

articles.title: Human papillomavirus vaccinations' association to childbirth rates.
articles.summary: HPV vaccination did not negatively impact childbirth rates, but may have delayed pregnancy due to sexual health counseling received during screening.

articles.title: The P7 peptide antagonizes bFGF-induced malignant behaviors of ovarian cancer by inhibiting MEK/ERK signaling pathway.
articles.summary: A novel P7 peptide blocks basic fibroblast growth factor's ability to promote ovarian cancer cell growth and spread by interrupting key signaling pathways.

articles.title: Environmental tobacco smoke exposure and pelvic inflammatory disease: a cross-sectional analysis of serum cotinine.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Exposure to secondhand smoke, as measured by serum cotinine levels, was associated with increased risk of pelvic inflammatory disease in non-smoking women.

articles.title: Elevated C-reactive protein to albumin ratio is a promising predictive biomarker for prognosis in patients with renal cell carcinoma.
articles.summary: High levels of inflammation markers (C-reactive protein to albumin ratio) can predict worse outcomes for patients with kidney cancer.

articles.title: Clinical characteristics and whole exome sequencing in JAK2V617F- and CALR-unmutated essential thrombocythemia.
articles.summary: In patients with essential thrombocythemia lacking known mutations, whole-exome sequencing revealed previously unidentified genetic drivers of the disease.

articles.title: Identification and biological evaluation of benzimidazole-based compounds as novel TGFβR1 inhibitors.
articles.summary: Researchers identified a novel benzimidazole compound (3282-0486) that effectively inhibits TGFβR1 and reduces colorectal cancer cell migration and survival.

articles.title: Evaluation of the immunotoxicity of atrazine and its chloro-metabolites: relevance for human cancer.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear, concise summary sentence:

Atrazine, a common herbicide, appears unlikely to cause significant immune system damage or increase cancer risk at typical human exposure levels.

articles.title: Discovery of novel and highly potent XIAP-targeted peptide inhibitors using virtual screening.
articles.summary: Researchers discovered a novel peptide (Peptide-5) that effectively inhibits lung cancer cell growth by targeting XIAP protein with high binding affinity and minimal toxicity.

articles.title: Engineering nanobodies for drug delivery systems in Alzheimer's disease.
articles.summary: Nanobodies can cross the blood-brain barrier and target Alzheimer's disease proteins, showing promise for developing new therapeutic strategies.

articles.title: Coriandrum sativum improves prognosis in clear cell renal cell carcinoma by targeting NEK6 to modulate the immune microenvironment: a predictive study based on network pharmacology and multi-omics analysis.
articles.summary: Coriander compounds target NEK6 in kidney cancer, potentially improving prognosis by enhancing immune response and offering a promising plant-based therapeutic approach.

articles.title: Development and validation of a predictive model for high-risk immune-related adverse events in gastric cancer patients treated with ICIs.
articles.summary: Researchers developed a predictive model using biomarkers to identify high-risk immune-related adverse events in gastric cancer patients treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors.

articles.title: Effect of Ileal Feces Transplantation in Preventing Diversion Colitis and Its Complications Due to Protective Loop Ileostomy in Rectal Cancer Cases.
articles.summary: Fecal transplantation significantly reduced inflammation and tissue damage in patients with rectal cancer who underwent protective loop ileostomy.

articles.title: Toward next-generation therapeutic HPV vaccines: A review on expanding the antigen repertoire and an integrated bioinformatics selection framework.
articles.summary: A comprehensive review proposes expanding HPV vaccine antigens beyond traditional targets to include neoantigens, using bioinformatics to guide more effective therapeutic vaccine design.

articles.title: Association between Gushen Antai recipe intervention and plasma cytokines during early pregnancy following IVF-ET: a cohort study.
articles.summary:
Here's a concise summary sentence:

A traditional Chinese herbal recipe (Gushen Antai) may improve early pregnancy outcomes after IVF by positively influencing plasma cytokine levels.

articles.title: Mucin-degrading gut bacteria: context-dependent roles in intestinal homeostasis and disease.
articles.summary: Mucin-degrading gut bacteria like Akkermansia muciniphila play complex, context-dependent roles in gut health and disease by modulating microbial ecosystems and host responses.

articles.title: Investigation of exercise-mimetic bioactive molecules as modulators of MMP activity and expression in cancer cells.
articles.summary: Exercise-mimetic molecules like Icariin and Berberine showed potential to inhibit lung cancer cell growth by targeting matrix metalloproteinases.

articles.title: Berberine derivative C51 modulates cGAS-STING-TIM-3 axis to reverse immune evasion and inhibit lung cancer growth.
articles.summary: A novel berberine derivative, C51, inhibits lung cancer growth by activating immune pathways and blocking cancer cells' ability to evade the immune system.

articles.title: Effects of estradiol, tamoxifen, and raloxifene on human temporal lobe cortex astroglial cell spreading.
articles.summary: Estradiol and two breast cancer drugs (tamoxifen and raloxifene) affect how brain support cells spread and change shape in the temporal lobe.

articles.title: Killing cancer takes guts: lessons learned from the manipulation of gut microbiome and immunotherapy for the future of urothelial carcinoma.
articles.summary:
Here's a clear summary sentence:

Manipulating gut bacteria may improve immune checkpoint inhibitor responses in urothelial carcinoma by enhancing the body's immune system function.

articles.title: The colloidal stability of albumin-based drug delivery systems has a profound effect on tumoricidal activity.
articles.summary: Researchers developed improved albumin-based nanoparticles with better colloidal stability, leading to enhanced paclitaxel drug delivery and increased tumor exposure in cancer treatment.

articles.title: Gut microbiome remodeling induced by microplastic exposure in humans.
articles.summary: Microplastic exposure alters gut microbiome composition, increasing potentially harmful bacteria and reducing beneficial microbes that produce protective fatty acids.

articles.title: NK cell-mediated tumor cell killing by bispecific innate cell engagers induces ADCC-mediated activation of primary human dendritic cells.
articles.summary: Bispecific antibodies targeting NK cells can activate dendritic cells, potentially enhancing the immune response against tumors by priming T cell responses.
